intro: Helianthus orgyaloides, commonly known as the yellow wood sunflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs and produces yellow, daisy-like flowers with ray florets surrounding a central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Helianthus orgyaloides is often found in open woods, prairies, and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
